post.summary: Adds a user to the Sentience Platform.
post.description:
Given the details of a user, a new user is created in the Sentience Platform. A caller provides an "IdentityTarget" header to decide and create a user in Azure Active Directory (Aad) or ForgeRock. If Header "IdentityTarget" is specified with the value of "ForgeRock", the API creates a user in ForgeRock If Header "IdentityTarget" is not specified or the value is "Aad", the API creates a user in the Azure Active Directory.

Authorization:GlobalActivity-CreateUser

Action:CreateUser

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: Details of the new user.

409.description: Conflict,if user exists.

500.description: Internal Server Error :Unexpected failure during the operation.

Authorization:GlobalActivity-CreateUser

Action:CreateUserWithLoginName

Systems are defined by systemType and webApiFactorySystemDetails, the registration result will be returned.

The system start with a provisioning status of NotProvisioned which can be modified by using the SystemRegistrationAdmin APIs.

post.summary: Generate a challenge for factory fixture authentication via RPK
post.description:
This API generates a cryptographically random number to challenge the caller. The caller is expected
            to sign the challenge with its own private key and submit the response to [api/authentication/fixture/rpkchallengeresponse] to authenticate itself

400.description:
Bad Request
                1) FixtureDetails is null
                2) FixtureDetail.FixtureId is null

401.description:
Unauthorized
                1) Fixture has expired

404.description:
Not Found
                1) Fixture not registered earlier

500.description: Internal Server Error

post.summary: Validate the challenge response for factory fixture authentication via RPK
post.description:
On successful validation this API returns a time limited JWT token that can be used
            to call api/systems/ to register system from the fixture.

400.description:
Bad Request
                1) challengeResponse is null
                2) challengeResponse.FixtureId is null
                3) challengeResponse.ClientRandom is null
                4) challengeResponse.ClientRandomSignature is null

401.description:
Unauthorized
                1) Challenge is expired
                2) Cannot validate challenge signature

404.description:
1) Fixture not registered
                2) No challenge generated for the fixure earlier

500.description: Internal Server Error

Authorization:GlobalActivity-ListModelTypes

Action:GetModelType

parameters.name: modelTypeId
parameters.description: modelTypeId

200.description: OK: The result is the model type with the requested modelTypeId.

401.description: Unauthorized: Lack of required permissions. Required activity: ListModelTypes.

403.description: Forbidden: Not allowed to get a model type.

404.description: NotFound: Model type with specified modelTypeId doesn't exists.

500.description: InternalServerError: Unexpected failure during internal operation.

post.summary: Creates a new application identity in Sentience Active Directory
post.description:
Register an Azure AD Application that can be used to make requests against the Sentience Platform.
By default the following permissions are added to the newly created application:
Global permission (CustomApplications) and Custom permission (ConfigureCustomPermission, CheckCustomPermission),
so that newly created application can have basic permission to consume Sentience Services
and to manage permissions for its downstream consumers.

Authorization:GlobalActivity-CreateCustomApplication

Action:RegisterApplicationV2

500.description: Internal Server Error: When any internal operations fail.

400.description: BadRequest: request is not on behalf of an user

post.summary: Creates an application identity in Sentience IAM.
post.description:
An authorized application or user can use this API to create an application identity in Sentience IAM. Note: The application identity will be created in ForgeRock. For creating application identity in Azure AD, please use the v2 version of this API.

Authorization:GlobalActivity-CreateCustomApplication

Action:RegisterApplicationV3

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The request which contains the parameters required to create the application identity.

400.description:
BadRequest: In following cases.
            1. ApplicationName is null or empty.
            2. RedirectionUrl is null or empty.
            3. RedirectionUrl is not https.
            4. If SupportEmail is provided but not in proper email format (Note: SupportEmail is an optional field though).
            5. Request body is null.

401.description: Unauthorized: The caller is not authorized to perform this action.

403.description: Forbidden: The caller is forbidden from performing this action.

409.description: Conflict: The application identity with the same name already exists.

500.description: InternalServerError: Unexpected failure during the operation.

get.summary: PREVIEW - Get the list of sub projects under a project.
get.description:
PREVIEW - This Api can be called by a user or application to get the list of all sub projects under a project. If the parent project is root, then pass base64Encoded "/" as the value of base64EncodedParentProjectName parameter.

Authorization:GlobalActivity-ManageProjects

Action:FetchProjects

parameters.name: base64EncodedParentProjectName
parameters.description: Pass the parent project name. If the parent project is root, then pass base64Encoded value of "/".

400.description:
BadRequest: On following cases
            1. If the project name starts with "/".
            2. If project name is null or empty.
            3. If the project name is not a valid base64 encoded value

401.description: Unauthorized: Authorization failed when trying to perform request. Please check permissions.

403.description: Forbidden: If the consumer is not having permission or the parent project is not found.

500.description: InternalServerError: Unexpected failure during the operation.

Bad Request
                1) SystemDetails is null
                2) SystemDetails.SystemType is null
                3) SystemDetails.SystemId is null

404.description:
Not Found
                1) System not registered from factory

post.summary: Validate a challenge response for system authentication via RPK

Bad Request
                1) systemChallengeResponse is null
                2) systemChallengeResponse.SystemType is null
                3) systemChallengeResponse.SystemId is null
                4) systemChallengeResponse.ClientRandom is null
                5) systemChallengeResponse.ClientRandomSignature is null

401.description:
Unauthorized
                1) Challenge is expired
                2) Cannot validate challenge signature
                3) Error when validating challenge signature

404.description:
1) System not registered from factory
                2) No challenge generated for the system earlier

500.description: Internal Server Error

get.summary: OBSOLETE: Retrieve the systems that have not been marked as connected.
get.description:
OBSOLETE: This API is marked for deletion.
This api retrieves systems that have not been marked as connected. This is an R1 call and is no longer supported in R2.
Returns 400: The systemId is invalid
Returns 500: The given systemType is not found, the combination of systemType and systemId is not found, or an unspecified error occured

Authorization:GlobalActivity-RegisterSystem

Action:GetUnconnectedSystemDetails

get.summary: OBSOLETE: Retrieve the first connection detail for a given SystemGuid.
get.description:

post.summary: Requests that resources be prepared so a system can connect and associates the system identity with a system guid
post.description:
This method allows a system to be prepared to be moved into the provisioning-allowed state. This call is meant to be called as part of the provisioning-allowed workflow. The following things are setup as part of this preparation. 1. Generate a unique SystemGuid for the system 2. Assign the system to a Tenant 3. Create security groups required to manage the system The provision state is not changed as part of this call. By separating this call from the allow-provisioning, we prevent a race-condition where a system could connect before an application has a chance to know the SystemGuid and setup system specific alarms or work with the create security groups

Authorization:GlobalOrSystemTypeOrFixtrueActivity-RegisterSystemType

Action:PrepareSystemForProvisioning2

404.description:
Not Found
The registration ID entered is not recognized.

409.description:
Conflict
The system you attempted to register is already in use.

500.description:
Internal Server Errors
1. Failed to add SystemGuid and ModelId map.
2. Failed to add system and AsuMaster map.
3. Failed to set provision status.
4. Unexpected error

post.summary: Requests that resources be prepared so a system can connect and associates the system identity with a system guid and sets given model to be default model
post.description:
This method allows a system to be prepared to be moved into the provisioning-allowed state. This call is meant to be called as part of the provisioning-allowed workflow. The following things are setup as part of this preparation. 1. Generate a unique SystemGuid for the system 2. Assign the system to a Tenant 3. Create security groups required to manage the system 4. Sets the given model as the default model for the system The provision state is not changed as part of this call. By separating this call from the allow-provisioning, we prevent a race-condition where a system could connect before an application has a chance to know the SystemGuid and setup system specific alarms or work with the create security groups

Authorization:GlobalOrSystemTypeOrFixtrueActivity-RegisterSystemType

Action:PrepareSystemForProvisioningAndSetDefaultModel

parameters.name: modelId
parameters.description: ModelId that will be set as the default model for the system

400.description:
Bad Request
1. SystemType, ownershipCode or tenantName is null.
2. Model Id does not belong to the same tenant.

401.description: Unauthorized: User or application is not authorized to invoke the API

404.description:
Not Found
The registration ID entered is not recognized.
The model Id is not valid.

409.description:
Conflict
The system you attempted to register is already in use.

500.description:
Internal Server Errors
1. Failed to add SystemGuid and ModelId map.
2. Failed to add system and AsuMaster map.
3. Failed to set provision status.
4. Failed to set default model.
5. Unexpected error

post.summary: OBSOLETE: Move a system into the Allow-Provisioning state.
post.description:
This method moves a system into the Allow-Provisioning state. This method should be preceded by 'api/systems/provisioning/prepare'. Once in Allow-Provisioning state, a system can make it's connection to the SystemRegistrationApi 'api/system/connections' to retrieve it's connection strings. On first call to the SystemRegistrationApi it will return 'Accepted' and do the actual provisioning. On the next call, once provisioning has been finished, the connection strings will be returned.

post.summary: OBSOLETE: Replace the system association with a new ownership code, keeping the same system identity
post.description:
PREVIEW - This method allows an already provisioned system to be replaced by another one, but keeping the same identity in the platform This API is meant to be called after the provisioning workflow. The following things are done as part of this operation: 1. Re-use the SystemGuid for the replacement system 2. Assign the replacement system to the Tenant 3. Un-assign the current system from the tenant 3. Set the status of the current system as NotProvisioned The provision state for the current system is changed to NotProvisioned in order to allow the deregistration of that system in a future call to the corresponding API.

Authorization:GlobalActivity-RegisterSystem

Action:ReplaceSystem

parameters.name: webApiSystemReplaceRequest
parameters.description:
System type: system type of the systems involved in the replacement operation.
             CurrentOwnershipCode: ownership code of the system that will by replaced by a new one.
             ReplacementOwnershipCode: ownership code of the new system that will replace the existing one.

400.description:
Bad Request
Invalid parameters. The system to be replaced is not in a valid state for replacement.

404.description:
Not Found
The unique id for the replacement system is not found. The unique id of the system to be replaced is not found.

500.description:
Internal Server Error
1. Failed to retrieve asu master map for both unique ids of the involved systems.
2. Failed to remove asu master map for unqieu id of the current system.
3. Failed to reset the provisioning state of the current system.
4. Failed to update map for system guid and the unique id of the replacement system.
5. Unexpected error.

404.description: NotFound: Unable to find the systemGuid for the given system type and system Id.

post.summary: Stops a system communicating with the platform by moving it into the disabled state.
post.description:
Disables a system so that it cannot communicate with cloud services. For a system that is currently provisioned all current credentials will be immediately invalidated and request for new connection details from the provisioning endpoint will fail. For a system that has never been provisioned attempts to prepare provisioning will fail. To allow the system to communicate again it should be moved into the provisioned state.

parameters.description: Type of the system to be disabled

parameters.name: base64EncodedSystemId
parameters.description: base 64 encoded system Id of the system to be disabled

BadRequest: System cannot be disabled as it is in 'NotProvisioned' state.
The decoded system Id should not be empty and should be less than 50 characters.

401.description: Unauthorized: The user or application is not part of the activity EnableDisableSystem.

404.description: NotFound: Unable to find the systemGuid for the given system type and system Id.

500.description: Internal Server Error: Unexpected error.

WebApiFixtureDetails.description: Contains details of the fixture which is registering devices.

FixtureRpkChallengeResponse.description: Contains response details for the Rpk challenge obtained for Fixture

Unique Id of the current fixture that is registered.This unique id shall be presented to following apis to uniquely identify the fixture
            1) api/authentication/fixture/rpkchallenge
            2) api/authentication/fixture/rpkchallengeresponse
            3) api/systems

            3) api/systems/batchimport

WebApiCreateApplicationRequest.description: The request data which holds the parameters required to create the application identity.

ApplicationName.description: Name of the application identity which needs to be created.

ApplicationLoginUrl.description:
The Login Url which needs to be linked with this application identity.
            This is optional for application identities.

RedirectionUrl.description:
The rediction Url which needs to be linked with this application identity.
            This should be https.

SupportEmail.description:
The email address of the support person or team who will be owning this application identity.
            This is optional.

SupportPhone.description: The phone number of the support person or team who will be owning this application identity.

SupportWebsite.description: The website of the support team who will be owning this application identity.

WebApiCreateApplicationResponse.description: The response data which contains the details about that application identity which is created.

ApplicationName.description: Name of the application  identity which is created.

ApplicationGuid.description: The Guid of the application  identity which is created.

BaseUrl.description: The Url from which an JWT token can be requested for this application.

SupportEmail.description: The email address of the support person or team who will be owning this application identity.

SupportPhone.description: The phone number of the support person or team who will be owning this application identity.

SupportWebsite.description: The website of the support team who will be owning this application identity.

ClientId.description:
The client id of the application identity which is created.
            This is very sensitive and should be treated as user id and should not be shared.

ClientSecret.description:
The client secret of the application identity which is created.
            This is very sensitive and should be treated as a password and should not be shared.

Realm.description:
The name of the realm which is linked with this application identity.
            This is used while requesting a JWT Token for this application identity.

WebApiCheckSelfPermissionRequest.description: Request object to check self permissions.

EntityType.description: Type of permission to be checked (e.g. System, SystemType, Model, ModelType, SystemTypeAndSystem, ModelTypeAndModel, Global).

EntityId.description: Id of the respective entity for permission needs to be checked (eg. SystemGuid for System and SystemTypeAndSystem, SystemTypeId for SystemType, ModelId for Model and ModelTypeAndModel, ModelTypeId for ModelType, Null for Global).

ActivityIds.description: List of activities to check permission.

Activity.description: Name of activity that requested to check permission

IsAuthorized.description: Requested activity is authorized or not

WebApiCheckPermissionRequest.description: Request object to check permissions for the other application/user.

EntityType.description: Type of permission to be checked (e.g. System, SystemType, Model, ModelType, SystemTypeAndSystem, ModelTypeAndModel, Global).

EntityId.description: Id of the respective entity for permission needs to be checked (eg. SystemGuid for System and SystemTypeAndSystem, SystemTypeId for SystemType, ModelId for Model and ModelTypeAndModel, ModelTypeId for ModelType, Null for Global).

ActivityIds.description: List of activities to check permission.

WebApiClaims.description: List of claims required to check permissions.

Type.description: Gets and Sets the claim type of the claim.

Value.description: Gets and Sets the value of the claim.

Name.description: Name of the project to be created

ParentProjectName.description: The parent project name. If the parent is root, the value should be "/"

Activities.description: List of activities to be created

ProjectName.description: Project name under which to create the activities. If the project is root, the value should be "/".

WebApiDeleteProjectActivitiesRequest.description: Payload for deleting the project activities

Tags.description: List of activities to be created

ProjectName.description: Project name under which to create the activities. If the project is root, the value should be "/".

WebApiDeleteProjectTagsRequest.description: Payload for deleting the project tags

WebApiProjectGlobalActivitiesRequest.description: Request object for project level permissions

GlobalActivities.description: Activities to which permissions are required

WebApiProjectActivitiesRequest.description: Request object for project activity permissions

Activities.description: Activities to which permissions are required

Path.description: Specifies the remote connection path. This is a URI. example.com:8042//EventStream//consumer"http://example.com:8042/EventStream/consumer or prtobuf://example.com:8042/EventStream/consumer

UserName.description: Specifies the user name used to authenticate a client trying to access a remote device/system/service. Typically used when the authentication mode is basic/digest

Password.description: Specifies the password used to authenticate a client trying to access a remote device/system/service. Typically used when the authentication mode is basic/digest

ServerType.description: Defines the conection server type for this connection set.  For IoTHub connections this would be IoTHub or IoTHub2.

AuthMode.description: None/Basic/Digest, Specifies the authentication type used to access a remote device/system/service

CredentialType.description: AES256, Specifies the encryption type used to encrypt the data/message while communicating with a remote device/system/service

Credential.description: session key, Specifies the encryption key used to encrypt the data/message that is sent to a remote device/system/service

UseExistingConnection.description: true/false, If set to true, specifies that an established connection would be used for communication with the remote device/system/service.

Certificate.description: ValueNet server certificate used for restricting to specific servers

CurrentOwnershipCode.description: Unique 8 digit code for current system

ReplacementOwnershipCode.description: Unique 8 digit code for replacement system

CurrentOwnershipCode.description: Unique 8 digit code for current system

ReplacementOwnershipCode.description: Unique 8 digit code for replacement system

SystemGuid.description: May be null if the System hasn't been associated yet

Details.description: Any specific details of the System. In the case of an RPK system, this is an JSON document with OwnershipCode, PublicKey and registring User

MetaData.description: Any extra metadata provided by the registering fixture or application, this is a JSON document with a dictionary.

OperationName.description: Operation name inside the query to be executed

Variables.description: A JSON-encoded object containing the variables for the query

errors.description:
Gets the GraphQL query execution errors.
            http://facebook.github.io/graphql/October2016/#sec-Errors

data.description:
Gets the resulting query object.
             Data will be provided only if there are no errors present.

line.description: Gets the line number where the error was found within the query

column.description: Gets the column where the error was found within the query

WebApiRegisterSystemServiceRequest.description: Request to register a System Service with the Provisioning Service. Simple System Services with a fixed URL for all devices should set this via the Url parameter of the request. System Services that have different connection details for each system can set the Callback parameter to the REST endpoint which will implement the callback interface that can provide connection details dynamically for each provisioned system. Only one of URL and Callback can be set for request.

Url.description: Url of the system service endpoint devices should use to communicate with the service. If this is supplied Callback should not be set.

Audience.description: Audience of the token which is used by system service

IsJwtRequired.description: Indicates if need Global to generate JWT token for the system service

Callback.description: Callback Url the provisioning service should use to request connection details for a device from the system service. If this is supplied Url should not be set.

SystemType.description: The system type name to be added

OwnershipCodeGenerationType.description: Indicates the rule to be used for generating the ownership code

DeviceType.description: The device type associated with the test group

Systems.description: The systems that are associated with the test group

Versions.description: The asset type and version pairs that are associated with the test group

CreatedById.description: AD Object id of the logged in user/application

CreatedBy.description: Name of the logged in user/application

ModifiedById.description: AD Object id of the logged in user/application

ModifiedBy.description: Name of the logged in user/application

ModifiedOn.description: Modified Date in UTC. Set a value only in update operations.

Version.description: The version to be used in the test group
